page.title: 02Holybourne Village
page.content:
{Holybourne}is a very old and picturesque village that lies about two miles from{Alton}in Hampshire. The name Holybourne is believed to derive from the Celtic practice of worship, and their dead being buried by the side of a stream.
The stream called the 'Holybourne' which runs to the{River Wey,}arises as springs in the pond next to the {village church.
{The Romans}rested in Holybourne when they were on their way to London. A lot of Roman pots and coins have been found in the Holybourne area, and on{Holybourne Down} and at{Neatham.}
The village developed during {The {Middle Ages,}and many old and beaitiful buildings still stand today.
